00039         frameLength(frameLengthMs), overlap(frameOverlap)

00048     WaveFile::~WaveFile()
00049     {
00050         if (frameLength != 0)
00051             clearFrames();

00065     void WaveFile::load(const std::string& file)
00066     {
00067         filename = file;
00068         LChTab.clear();
00069         RChTab.clear();
00070         if (frameLength != 0)
00071             clearFrames();
00072 
00073         // first we read header from the stream
00074         // then as we know now the data size, we create a temporary
00075         // buffer and read raw data into that buffer
00076         std::fstream fs;
00077         fs.open(filename.c_str(), std::ios::in | std::ios::binary);
00078         loadHeader(fs);
00079         short* data = new short[hdr.WaveSize/2];
00080         loadRawData(fs, data, hdr.WaveSize);
00081         fs.close();
00082 
00083         // initialize data channels (using right channel only in stereo mode)
00084         unsigned int channelSize = hdr.WaveSize/hdr.BytesPerSamp;
00085         LChTab.resize(channelSize);
00086         if (2 == hdr.Channels)
00087             RChTab.resize(channelSize);
00088 
00089         // most important conversion happens right here
00090         if (16 == hdr.BitsPerSamp)
00091         {
00092             if (2 == hdr.Channels)
00093                 convert16Stereo(data, channelSize);
00094             else
00095                 convert16Mono(data, channelSize);
00096         }
00097         else
00098         {
00099             if (2 == hdr.Channels)
00100                 convert8Stereo(data, channelSize);
00101             else
00102                 convert8Mono(data, channelSize);
00103         }
00104 
00105         // clear the buffer
00106         delete [] data;
00107 
00108         // when we have the data, it is possible to create frames
00109         if (frameLength != 0)
00110             divideFrames(LChTab);
00111     }
00112 
00118     unsigned int WaveFile::getAudioLength() const
00119     {
00120         return static_cast<unsigned int>(hdr.WaveSize /
00121                 static_cast<double>(hdr.BytesPerSec) * 1000);
00122     }

00134     void WaveFile::saveFrames(const std::string& filename, unsigned int begin,
00135             unsigned int end) const
00136     {
00137         if (1 == hdr.Channels && 8 == hdr.BitsPerSamp)
00138         {
00139             throw FormatException("Save error: 8-bit mono files are not supported yet!");
00140         }
00141         unsigned int samples = getSamplesPerFrame();
00142 
00143         // calculate the boundaries of a fragment of the source channel
00144         // which correspond to given frame numbers
00145         unsigned int startPos = static_cast<unsigned int>(
00146                 begin * samples * (1 - overlap));
00147         unsigned int endPos = static_cast<unsigned int>(
00148                 (end + 1) * samples * (1 - overlap) + samples * overlap);
00149         if (endPos > LChTab.size())
00150             endPos = LChTab.size();
00151 
00152         // number of data bytes in the resulting wave file
00153         unsigned int waveSize = (endPos - startPos) * hdr.BytesPerSamp;
00154 
00155         // prepare a new header and write it to file stream
00156         WaveHeader newHdr;
00157         std::strncpy(newHdr.RIFF, hdr.RIFF, 4);
00158         newHdr.DataLength = waveSize + sizeof(WaveHeader);
00159         std::strncpy(newHdr.WAVE, hdr.WAVE, 4);
00160         std::strncpy(newHdr.fmt_, hdr.fmt_, 4);
00161         newHdr.SubBlockLength = hdr.SubBlockLength;
00162         newHdr.formatTag = hdr.formatTag;
00163         newHdr.Channels = hdr.Channels;
00164         newHdr.SampFreq = hdr.SampFreq;
00165         newHdr.BytesPerSec = hdr.BytesPerSec;
00166         newHdr.BytesPerSamp = hdr.BytesPerSamp;
00167         newHdr.BitsPerSamp = hdr.BitsPerSamp;
00168         std::strncpy(newHdr.data, hdr.data, 4);
00169         newHdr.WaveSize = waveSize;
00170 
00171         std::fstream fs;
00172         fs.open(filename.c_str(), std::ios::out | std::ios::binary);
00173         fs.write((char*)&newHdr, sizeof(WaveHeader));
00174 
00175         // convert our data from source channels to a temporary buffer
00176         short* data = new short[waveSize/2];
00177         for (unsigned int i = startPos, di = 0; i < endPos; ++i, ++di)
00178         {
00179             if (16 == hdr.BitsPerSamp)
00180             {
00181                 if (2 == hdr.Channels)
00182                 {
00183                     data[2*di] = LChTab[i];
00184                     data[2*di+1] = RChTab[i];
00185                 }
00186                 else
00187                 {
00188                     data[di] = LChTab[i];
00189                 }
00190             }
00191             else
00192             {
00193                 if (2 == hdr.Channels)
00194                 {
00195                     data[di/2] = ((RChTab[i] + 128) << 8) | (LChTab[i] + 128);
00196                 }
00197             }
00198         }
00199 
00200         // write the raw data to file and clean the buffer
00201         fs.write((char*)data, waveSize);
00202         fs.close();
00203         delete [] data;
00204     }

00212     void WaveFile::recalculate(unsigned int newFrameLength, double newOverlap)
00213     {
00214         if (newFrameLength != 0)
00215             frameLength = newFrameLength;
00216 
00217         overlap = newOverlap;
00218 
00219         clearFrames();
00220         divideFrames(LChTab);
00221     }
00222 
00229     void WaveFile::loadHeader(std::fstream& fs)
00230     {
00231         fs.read((char*)(&hdr), sizeof(WaveHeader));
00232     }
00233 
00241     void WaveFile::loadRawData(std::fstream& fs, short* buffer,
00242             int bufferLength)
00243     {
00244         fs.read((char*)buffer, bufferLength);
00245     }
00246 
00253     void WaveFile::convert16Stereo(short *data, unsigned int channelSize)
00254     {
00255         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < channelSize; ++i)
00256         {
00257             LChTab[i] = data[2*i];
00258             RChTab[i] = data[2*i+1];
00259         }
00260     }
00261 
00268     void WaveFile::convert16Mono(short *data, unsigned int channelSize)
00269     {
00270         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < channelSize; ++i)
00271         {
00272             LChTab[i] = data[i];
00273         }
00274     }
00275 
00282     void WaveFile::convert8Stereo(short *data, unsigned int channelSize)
00283     {
00284         // low byte and high byte of a 16b word
00285         unsigned char lb, hb;
00286         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < channelSize; ++i)
00287         {
00288             splitBytes(data[i/2], lb, hb);
00289             // left channel is in low byte, right in high
00290             // values are unipolar, so we move them by half
00291             // of the dynamic range
00292             LChTab[i] = lb-128;
00293             RChTab[i] = hb-128;
00294         }
00295     }
00296 
00303     void WaveFile::convert8Mono(short *data, unsigned int channelSize)
00304     {
00305         // low byte and high byte of a 16b word
00306         unsigned char lb, hb;
00307         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < channelSize; ++i)
00308         {
00309             splitBytes(data[i/2], lb, hb);
00310             // only the left channel collects samples
00311             LChTab[i] = lb-128;
00312         }
00313     }
00314 
00322     void WaveFile::splitBytes(short twoBytes, unsigned char& lb,
00323             unsigned char& hb)
00324     {
00325         lb = twoBytes & 0x00FF;
00326         hb = (twoBytes >> 8) & 0x00FF;
00327     }
00328 
00337     void WaveFile::divideFrames(const WaveFile::channelType& source)
00338     {
00339         // calculate how many samples are in the part of the frame
00340         // which does NOT overlap, and use that value to find out
00341         // total number of frames; also set zero-padded length
00342         samplesPerFrame = getSamplesPerFrame();
00343         unsigned int samplesPerNonOverlap =
00344             static_cast<unsigned int>(samplesPerFrame * (1 - overlap));
00345         unsigned int framesCount =
00346             (hdr.WaveSize / hdr.BytesPerSamp) / samplesPerNonOverlap;
00347         unsigned int power =
00348             static_cast<unsigned int>(std::log(double(samplesPerFrame))/log(2.0));
00349         zeroPaddedLength = 1 << (power + 1);
00350 
00351         frames.reserve(framesCount);
00352         unsigned int indexBegin = 0, indexEnd = 0;
00353         for (unsigned int i = 0, size = source.size(); i < framesCount; ++i)
00354         {
00355             // calculate frame boundaries in the source channel
00356             // when frame end exceeds channel size, break out
00357             indexBegin = i * samplesPerNonOverlap;
00358             indexEnd = indexBegin + samplesPerFrame;
00359             if (indexEnd < size)
00360                 frames.push_back(new Frame(source, indexBegin, indexEnd));
00361             else
00362                 break;
00363         }
00364     }
00365 
00369     void WaveFile::clearFrames()
00370     {
00371         for(unsigned int i = 0, size = frames.size(); i < size; ++i)
00372         {
00373             delete frames[i];
00374         }
00375 
00376         frames.clear();
00377     }
